text: Draught at Klub Malych Pivovaru, as Bratcice Sklepak 13% Polotmave (after the relocation, Oslavany beers are now Bratcice beers). Deep, light toasted maltiness balanced by light hops. Clean profile, thickish and very soft mouthfeel. Very sessionable brew.
Draught in Brno: Hazy amber color, off-white creamy head. Sourly aroma and flavor. Probably infected and fault of the pub....

En fût. Pinte dégustée chez U Vech Čertů (Brno, République-Tchèque). Arôme: Légère odeur de céréales et de caramel fruité. Apparence: La couleur est orangée. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût dorange et de céréales avec une pointe fruitée. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence doranges en arrière goût. (Rating #4854)

On tap U Vsech Certu (04/03/13). Hazy dark gold/amber pour with creamy white head. Aroma of well done toast, a strong yeast charachter is present in the aroma, fruity esters are just reminiscent enough of alcohol. Roasty flavor, light yeastiness, fruity body, hops remain to be found, slightly mineral on the finish. Palate is rich and creamy yet very easy drinking. Not a remarkable example but a highly drinkable beer.

My Bottom Line:
This velvety Polotmava shares lots of yeasty aromas atop herbal hops and caramel malts.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A super creamy, thick head of foam covers the cloudy dark amber.
-This might not be a refined example, but it is comfy and flavorful.
-Light fruitiness is found. With the yeasty touch, it points towards short lagering...
-Mouthfeel is very rich and creamy. As if a touch of nitrogen was used to carbonate the beer...

On tap at the brewpub.
Pours copper with a beige head. Aroma is roasted caramel, fruity notes, light grass and dried fruit. Flavour is roasted caramel, butter, grass, pine and dark dried fruit.

Drafted at Klub Malych Pivovaru,the Czech version of this style usually has a redish color, but it looks more like a lager,golden with a white foamy head.Aromas of cinnamon rolls,nutmeg,hot wine,icing.Has a wonderful flavor,cinnamon roll dough,yeast, raisin, vanilla, woody.Im really diggin this beer.

(draught 0,5l)
Fruit, light yeast aroma. Light sparkling amber-red color. Medium light brown head. Light bitter-sweet. Bitter end.
RBESG08. Cloudy red amber, creamy golden head. Light bready nose. Fruity, light bready, good balance. Chewy, good mouthfeel.

On tap. Slightly hazy amber golden with a dense off-white and lacing head. Sweet caramel in the nose. Medium body, low carbonation and a soft mouthfeel. Sweet caramel and malt - almost candy-like - yet balanced with solid hops. 270608

June 2008. Draught at Vinarna Hrozen, Plzen. Pale amber colour. Good balance of malt, hops and butterscotch, both in aroma and flavour. Solid Czech Vienna Bohemian Style. It’s tasty and good floral hoppy. Medium bitter.

[tap]
Sweet, alcoholic malt with a little dried fruit and vinous character.  Hazy reddish amber with only a pale white ring.  Malty and bitter flavour with some dried fruit, but sort of thin.  Light body, moderate carbonation, Soda watery.
Clear deep amber with medium off white head. Sweet aroma with hoppy and caramel notes. Flavor is sweet with caramel malt, hops and fruity notes. Ends bitter.

(6/27/08) Draught at Vinarna Hrozen in Plzen. Amber color with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, some berries hints and a bit of caramel. Sweetish flavor, quite malty, with a lightly drier finish and hints of metal. Medium-bodied.

(Draught at U Věstonického Venoue, Prague, 21 July 2008) Pale amber colour, cloudy, with a frothy, white head. Malty, yeasty, citric nose with notes of hay and lemon. Malty, yeasty taste with toffee, caramel, hay and a grassy, bitter finish. Slightly citric (or acidic), starts sweet and turnes drier towards the finish. Rather complex. Nice, but kind of strange.
Draught at RBESG. Clear amber - wvite head. Sweetness, dark bread, brown sugar, red berries, soapy, caramel, grainy.
From tap @ Vinarna Hrozen, Plzen. Semi clear and amber coloured with a medium sized head. Quite well balanced with notes of malt, caramel, bread and grain.
Draft at Vinarna Hrozen during RBESG 2007. A hazy amber beer with a thick orangey head. THe aroma is sweet malty with notes of caramel and straw, and so is the flavor, leading to a dry bitter finish.
Light amber with a small white head. Ar0oma has some butterscotch, pilsner malt sulphur and a little caramel. Flavour begins sweet, but has a good bitter hop attack.

Tap @ Vinarna Hrozen, Plzen.
Pours amber with a small, frothy, off-white head. Aroma is sweet, good caramel notes. Rather thin mouthfeel. Flavour is sweet, lightly metallic, some light hoppy dryness and a fair dose of caramel.

From tap at Hrozen. Pours clear and golden amber with a lacing white head. Aroma is mild roasted malt, light metallic and mild fruity. Flavour is light fruity and with a subdued metallic note. Slowly building bitterness into the finish.
Draught at Vinarna Hrozen, Plzen. No.9 on tasting list. Brown amber with white head. Sweet, malty beer, a little tinny with a cardboard note. Bready, yeasty finish.

Draught at Vinarna Hrozen, Plzen Clear amber, thin beige head.  Some actual decent malt on aroma.  Cereal and some toffee in mouth.  Then ther is a building hoppiness on finish that almost burns the tongue.  The most malty of the beers so far.  That hint of aluminium I’ve detected on some of these beers and then this buidling hop.
Draught. Amber colour, small head. Aroma is malts, hops, some grass and fruitishly yeasty hints. Flavour is malts, caramel, sour wood and some yeast in a very nice balance. Ends in a nice bitterness.
(Draught in Plzen)On June 27, 2008Shady copper color, small tan head. Yeasty, bready, dough scent. Sweet, yeasty, fruity taste. MEdium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.
Tap at the place with 12 taps 2 kegs and no idea how to pour beer. Alround rating: Pale and caramalt, sulphury peppery hop, bitter finish.
UPDATED: JUL 8, 2008 Draft (hand bottled for next day)at Vinarna Hrozen at RBESG ...brown yeasty and plums ... lots of malts ... quite fruity ... but big bitterness... slight burnt carmel

Draught at Vinarna Hrozen, Plzen. 
The eighth beer of the Vinarna Hrozen tasting at the RBESG 2008. Light hazy amber coloured, small (almost no) beige head, dusty nose. Aroma of hops and caramel with nutty notes and light touch of alcohol in the herbal hoppy finish.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2008 Draught at Vinarna Hrozen, Pilsen.  Hazy amber, beige small head. Aroma of hay and cramel. Medium sweet with wonderfully soft vital and relaxed mouthfeel. Medium bodied with lots of green hops and some caramelized sugar. Finishes with long herbal bitterness. Almost superb in every aspect!

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2008 No.9 at the Vinarna Hrozen RBESG tasting. There was a bit of a mix up between this and the no.8, but Im pretty sure  that Im rating the right thing.  Poured a amber-orange, slightly brownish colour with no head when I got to it.  Eggy and barnyardy aroma. The taste was better than expected. A nice fruity maltiness, passionfruit, and a nice all-round hopiness (and something). A hoppy aftertaste. Liked it

draught at Vonarna U vestonickeho venouse in Prague. Amber colour, slightly hazy, large and very creamy head. Full-bodied, very malty with hints of caramel and roasted malt. A tiny touch of fruit is also present. Hoppy and dry in the finish. A very well-balanced Vienna - heavenly!

on tap at vinarna hrozen in plzen. honeyed amber appearance with a thick pancake mix head and light lacing. sweet, grassy aroma, lightly floral. hint of tinned peach flavour, chocolate, red berries and an appreciably bitter finish. improved a lot as it warmed
